src:
Polisi Tetapkan Tersangka Pembunuhan Eks Wartawan di Medan
05 Nov 2019, 08:11 by Andita Rahma, Syailendra Persada
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Polisi telah menetapkan dua orang berinisial VS dan SB sebagai tersangka pembunuhan dua orang mantan jurnalis, Maraden Sianipar dan Martua Siregar di Medan, Sumatera Utara.
"Dari hasil penyelidikan, sudah ada dua orang yang kami tetapkan tersangka inisial VS dan SB. Saat ini masih diperiksa," kata Kepala Satuan Reserse Kriminal Kepolisian Resor Labuhanbatu, Ajun Komisaris Jama Kita Purba saat dihubungi pada Selasa, 5 November 2019.
Jama mengatakan, VS dan SB merupakan orang yang kenal dengan kedua korban. Kendati demikian, ia belum membeberkan motif pembunuhan ini VS dan SB.
Sebelumnya, Maraden dan Martua ditemukan tewas di selokan areal perkebunan kelapa sawit PT SAB/KSU Amelia, Desa Wonosari, Kecamatan Panai Hilir, Kabupaten Labuhanbatu, Sumatera Utara. Mereka tewas dengan luka sabetan senjata tajam di kepala, badan, lengan, punggung, dada, dan perut.
Keduanya ditemukan dalam waktu yang berbeda. Maraden pada 30 Oktober 2019 sekitar pukul 16.00 WIB, sedangkan Maratua ditemukan keesokan harinya, 31 Oktober 2019, pada pukul 10.30 WIB.
text:
Police Determine Ex-Journalist Murder Suspect in Medan
05 Nov 2019, 08:11 by Andita Rahma, Syailendra Persada
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Police have named VS and SB as the suspects of the murder of two former journalists, Maraden Sianipar and Martua Siregar in Medan, North Sumatra.
"From the results of the investigation, there are already two people who we have named VS and SB's initial suspects. At present they are still being investigated," said Labuhanbatu Resort Police Criminal Investigation Unit Chief, Adjunct Commissioner Jama Kita Purba when contacted on Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
Jama said, VS and SB were people who knew the two victims. Nevertheless, he has not revealed the motive for this murder VS and SB.
Previously, Maraden and Martua were found dead in the gutters of the Amelia PT SAB / KSU oil palm plantation, Wonosari Village, Panai Hilir District, Labuhanbatu Regency, North Sumatra. They died with sharp weapons wounds on the head, body, arms, back, chest and stomach.
Both are found in different times. Maraden on 30 October 2019 around 16:00 WIB, while Maratua was found the next day, 31 October 2019, at 10:30 WIB.
